name: Harbour House Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012
reviews.text: My wife and I spent a wonderful romantic getaway at Harbour House. We have stayed at other top rated hotels in NOTL, but this was the best...and perhaps the very best period! The service from the moment you walk in is first class and friendly. They show you to your room and explain all the ammenities. If you need dining reservations, they will make them and you can take a free shuttle if need be. However, the location by the water and numerous boats is so good that we just parked our car (for free) and walked everywhere. The rooms are spacious with leather chairs, fireplace, large flat screen tv, and the most comfortable bed. The bathroom has both a separate shower and two person whirlpool tub. The decor throughout is both nautical and contemporary, and particularly clean. Another terrific feature is the daily wine tasting with glasses of red and white local wines, cheese, crackers, and cookies. And then there is the included breakfast! Too many delicious items to mention but the smoked salmon and homemade granola were standouts. I can't recommend this hotel enough, and if you can get the Travelzoo deal we got, it makes it a great value as well. We look forward to a return trip to Harbour House.
reviews.title: This hotel is fantastic for couples!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This was one of the most lovely inns in which we have ever stayed. Rooms were spacious, yet warm and cozy with a large fireplace, desk, internet in the room, view of the harbour and the boats, soft Frette sheets and lovely ammenitites in the bathroom. The bed was the most comfortable ever - with down pillow top and soft down comforter. Breakfast was outstanding - all homemade with both gourmet hot food as well as cold (yummy homemade granola too). A nice perk in the late afternoon was the complimentary wine and cheese in the main sitting room by the fire - great way to mingle with other guests. They even had libraries of books and DVD's you could borrow for your room. Larissa created a personal package for us to suit our needs (private wine tours, gourmet dinners, etc). An absolutely fabulous place to call "home away from home".
reviews.title: Incredible luxury

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: My sister and I spent a night at this wonderful hotel. The room was very warm and the bathroom was lovely. The beds were so comfortable! The staff was very friendly. The breakfast was great, lots of choices. We have stayed at many of NOTL hotels Shaw club, Queens Landing, The Pillar and Post etc. This one is defintely at the top of the list. I would recommend it to my friends.
reviews.title: Harbour House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our recent stay was to celebrate my Birthday. It was our first time here, but we will stay only here from now on. The best service, as you fell like you are part of a special place with the wine tasting in the afternoon where we met some lovely other couples. It is very nice that they also have the evening shuttle to pick you up from anywhere in town. This makes it easy to have and enjoy a special dinner with wine. The view from our room was amazing overlooking the river and though it was winter - no snow very unusual for this time, but we would come back just to enjoy the beautifully appointed room with the king bed, movie night in the room later on for free and the lovely " spa" bathroom. We will be back again, Alex and Glenn,Toronto, ON
reviews.title: Excellent get-away location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed at Harbour House this past Feb 10th and was more than pleased with all aspects of the hotel. From the inital booking and confirmation to our arrival on the Friday, the staff really do everything to make you feel welcome. We loved the underground parking garage (which was perfect because of the snow that fell overnight) and the elevator up to the front lobby. We had a staff member take us to our room and show us the amenities which is a lovely touch and the room was beautiful - comfy King bed, fireplace, jacuzzi tub and a special little gift bag with 2 home baked cookies! As well, our room had a little journal on the table that guests had put their notes in (which we added to as well) and it was nice to hear about why people had stayed there and where they were visiting from. Lovely touch.
reviews.title: A wonderful way to celebrate Valentines!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is one of the finest hotels we have encountered, The staff were excellent; our dog was cared for excellently; the quality of the room was superb. Breakfast was outstanding. This was, simply, an outstanding stay.
reviews.title: Harbour House is perhaps the best hotel we have encountered--certainly among the smallest ones.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had the BEST time in Niagrara on the Lake and the Harbour House is very special. Great beds, wonderful deep tubs, friendly and helpful staff and amazing breakfasts. Joseph ( who drives and picks up from restaurants) is a hoot and very much filled with local folklore. Thank you Harbour House for a special birthday weekend.
reviews.title: Amazing- Great birthday!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent two nights at the Harbour House Hotel in January. The property is located across from the marina and the Niagara River. The pretty town of Niagara on the Lake is an easy walk and includes quaint shops and superior restaurants. We were upgraded to a suite when the room we requested was not available due to off season painting of rooms. The room had a living room with a fireplace and flat screen t.v. in addition to a comfy chair and desk. The area was stylishly decorated with a nautical theme. The separate bedroom had a feather mattress and a down duvet which was airy, but warm. An additional t.v. was in that area. Our massive windows overlooked the river. A romantic extra was the double jetted tub, complete with a candle, wine glass and rubber ducky! The entire staff was accommodating, informative and courteous. Each afternoon, wine and potted cheese was available and in the morning, a scrumptious breakfast was provided. Carol, our server, was delightful!
reviews.title: Intimate, Stylish Inn in a Lovely Setting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is one of the best we have found.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed overnight at the Harbour House hotel Dec 28/29 as part of the Best Dining package. It was our first stay in Niagara-on-the-Lake.
reviews.title: Our mini-winter get-away ...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From start to finish, the service, staff, accommodations, everything was perfect to the smallest detail. Upon arrival, my partner and I were by courteous and knowledgeable staff. A personalized note with cookies was in the room waiting for us. The mood was set with jazz music playing on the radio as we entered the room. We booked the Superior room and requested the double jacuzzi tub. The room included a gas fireplace. Dinner was at Charles Inn; the shuttle ride over and back, the driver was fantastic and in a great mood. Breakfast at the Conservatory area, great service from the staff, amzaing layout of fresh fruits, pastries, homemade jams, freshly brewered coffees. Parking was plentiful at the Harbour House hotel.
reviews.title: Quaint Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This trip was wonderful. I'm giving it a 10, and I can't wait to go back in the summer.

reviews.title: Fantastic room

reviews.title: Whales from a posh window!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were given an upgraded 'romantic' ground floor room right on the front so it was very easy to see when other whale watchers spotted one, grab the camera and run out. Mid Ocotober and we easily saw several whales each and every day of our 3 day stay.
reviews.title: Amazing room and view but skip the breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was expansive and nicely furnished; every amenity one could ask for, including a DVD service. The bed was amazingly comfortable. There is a garage under the hotel for guests' cars. Most importantly, the staff was very accommodating and just plain nice. The hotel is only a few steps from Lake Ontario. I would recommend it highly.
reviews.title: Impressive in every way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a great place to stay! We loved it. The service was remarkable and the room was magnificent. They helped us plan a great set of tasting tours and really knew what they were talking about. Can't beat this place!
reviews.title: There is no where better then this!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Literally the nicest, most attentive staff I've ever experienced. The guy at the front desk actually walked us to our room. After showing us around, we were talking about restaurants in the area and he asked if we would like to have a wine and cheese plate in the lobby while we look at menus.
reviews.title: Excellent in every way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Really, really nice place. Rooms were awesome. I stayed in room 209 (a corner suite) and had a nice view of the harbor. Bathroom was very large with an extra wide tub and large glass shower.
reviews.title: I didn't ever want to leave

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I checked into Harbour House in the late evening last week, and found immediately upon arrival that the staff, decor, and service were professional, friendly and inviting. Upon entering our room, I was automatically overwhelmed with a sense of luxury! The king size feather bed, beautiful big leather arm chair, and tub for two were of the finest quality, and invited you to immediately enter a state of relaxation and comfort. Details nor expense are spared in the quality of all the room furnishing and extra touches - a waterproof crossword and tray for the tub, beautiful wine glasses and water pitchers by the bed, and 300 thread count linens. As stated, we never wanted to leave, and I can only attempt to wait patiently for our next visit... an absolute treat and a weekend you will remember!
reviews.title: “Can’t wait to come back”

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I, and others, had problems with the in-room wi-fi. To be fair there was free internet available next to the Spa/Massage area. However as somebody staying longer I was impressed that as a way to speed up my connectivity they provided me with an in-room hub which was connected to the main hotel's broadband link for free access during my stay.
reviews.title: Great location and value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: A warm and helpful check-in is always a good start. And we had one, including prompt assistance for an ill member of our party. Rooms are modern, well equipped and front facing rooms enjoy a good harbour view. The front office manager, Bronwen, escorted us to a nearby fish restaurant as the adjacent Burgundy restaurant (recommended) was full. Ask the hotel to book it in advance for you. Pool area is great, especially for whale watching. Location is also superb, adjacent to the old harbour, and walking distance to the main attractions. Breakfast was a mixed experience. The restaurant was severely understaffed and the lone waiter soon became besieged by annoyed patrons. Some of our party gave up and left, while others were served promptly and enjoyed a good breakfast. There was a surge of customers at the time and the hotel should ensure they have efficient backup staff. Apart from the besieged Indian waiter, the other serving staff were ineffective. Next time, I would take breakfast at the Burgundy, a great place.
reviews.title: Great location, fine property
Perfect for whale watching
reviews.text: Everything about the Harbour House is first class. The views from the front of the hotel are perfect for whale watching. The hotel is right in the middle of the town. Very close to some excellent resturants and cliff top walks . Not cheap but you get what you pay for. Highly recommended.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we arrived we were a bit disappointed that they did not know about the offer we booked through their website that included a whalewatch in the stay, and it took some time to be sorted. However they did help as much as they could to make our stay as we expected. When they confirmed the whalewatch, they informed us that it was with a provider located in 40 min drive because they are the same than the cage to view sharks... but we obviously complained because this was not detailed in the offer and we drove a lot to get there and never expected to be on the road for this activity. We would have booked in other closer village probably or never booked this deal so we could book the activity with any of the local providers. They understood us perfectly and helped booking with a different provider in town with no extra cost. So we did the activity the following morning in Hermanus.
reviews.title: Unique location. comfortable room and nice staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is unique, breakfast was very good, the room was very modern and comfortable, but what we did value was the service helping us sort out the confusion and book the whalewatching in town. What I did not like was the noise from the bars in the night... the hotel is very close to all restaurants and bars and I don't know if we were unlucky that weekend, but both nights were very noisy until 1 or 2 am. I cannot penalize them for this though because I did not complain about it.
reviews.title: Couldn't get closer to the action

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012
reviews.text: I'm actually writing this sitting on my deck looking out at the whales passing by Hermanus. The hotel is situated right next to the heart of Hermanus and on the cliffs over looking the bay. Very beautiful spot and an absolute recommend. The new pool and bar area is amazing - a bit cold right now but in summer it would be a great spot to sit and enjoy the view with a beer or wine.
reviews.title: Amazing location and view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Normally a hotel of this type would be out of my price range but a found a special sale and the wife and I needed to get away so we booked a two night stay here. The hotel is great. We had a large room with a whirlpool tub. They offer a fantastic breakfast which includes a full continental breakfast plus some additional hot items. In the late afternoon, they serve complimentary wine and cheese. There is not restaurant in the hotel itself but there are many choices nearby. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay.
reviews.title: A Relaxing Escape

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Wonderful escape with a sister who shares the same birthday. Bruce greeted us with birthday wishes, cake and helpful info on creating a great stay. Unbelievable dinner at the Charles Inn Restaurant (plate licking good), woke to a great breakfast in Harbour House dinning room and then went for a relaxing massage at the Shaw Spa - a fantastic girl's getaway! Thank you to all the staff that go "beyond the distance" to creating an inviting and special stay!
reviews.title: Harbour House Girl's Getaway
Excellent overnight "Snique Away"!!
reviews.text: My husband and I just returned from an overnight stay which we booked through "Snique Away". This Tripadvisor "top-rated hotel deserves all the accolades it has received! From the moment we were greeted at the door by welcoming staff, we knew we were in for a very special experience. We were escorted to our room by Bruce, who gave us a tour of the hotel and described all of the amenities which included free wine and cheese sampling which we enjoyed on the small, private patio, home baked cookies in our room, a gift bag, gas fireplace, jacuzzi, feather top beds, down pillows and duvets, and more. The room was larger than usual and was the cleanest we've EVER stayed in. The next morning, we enjoyed the delicious European style breakfast which is included in the room rate and served in the beautiful conservatory dining room - a scrumptious breakfast casserole, homemade breads and sweet breads, home made yogurt, fruit, meats and cheeses, cereals, coffee, juice and more. This truly is a wonderful boutique hotel with 1st class food, amenities, and staff!! We'll be back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for only one night celebrating my birthday. We bought a package that included a night's stay, a couples massage and dinner at the Charles Inn (an affiliate)
reviews.title: Refreshingly Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is our new favourite spot!!! The rooms are charming, romantic and wonderfully clean. The staff is friendly and helpful and will go out of their way for you. We felt at home the minute we walked through the doors. Wine and cheese at 4 pm and a little birthday cake in our room to celebrate were just some of the additional "perks" you can expect. Breakfast in the morning was a real treat. The Dinner at the Charles Inn was one of the best meals we have had in a long time and we have been to many white table cloth restaurants. I highly recommend this Hotel as well as the Restaurant at the Charles Inn to anyone.
reviews.title: Harbour House 2 day getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is absolutely fabulous. Room was excellent, beautifully decorated, balcony, sea views and also kitchen area with everything you could wish for all provided.
reviews.title: Couldn't have wished for better!!

reviews.text: Breakfast was wonderful.
reviews.title: Got to improve services for guests

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012
reviews.text: Staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Able to watch whales from the balcony of room.
reviews.title: Beautiful spot, but lacking a personal touch

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a small spa in the hotel which is reasonably priced. Wi fi i s available also.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: The location of the hotel is right next to the town square, which has some fantastic restaurants.
reviews.title: Nice experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our third stay at this boutique hotel and the standards never vary - always magnificent. From excellent staff, beautiful rooms, afternoon wine tasting, European breakfasts and private car shuttle to and from restaurants in Niagara-on-the-lake - what more could you ask for.
reviews.title: Magnificent as always

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first stay at the Harbour House and definitely will return, soon hopefully! The service was truly wonderful. The staff were attentive and genuinely friendly. Close to shopping and theatre yet away from the crowds...best of both worlds. Beautifully maintained property; covered parking was welcomed in the snow. Wine and cheese reception as well as the European breakfast simply add to the "I don't want to leave" feeling. A choice you won't regret!
reviews.title: A pleasant find...a beautiful getaway!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have a food allergy. Every time my husband and I visit my family in Ridgeville we now book room in Niagara on the Lake to have a break from them. I love them, but they are a high stress situation, so much so, we now book a room away from them for one night! We had such a wonderful time at the last place, Victoria Gables Bed & Breakfast, we thought all hotels, B and B's would be as helpful as them! WRONG! I have celiac disease, and when they, Harbour House, asked me on the phone when I called if I had any food allergies I was ecstatic they asked! It is such a frustrating food problem, that is why we go these small places, to be catered to! Silly me, when they asked I thought they would give a hoot! We show up, cookies in the room my husband has to handle. Wine and cheese? Full gluten crackers and gluten filled cheese. I ask them if they have any gluten free items, and they say no. I remind them I have a serious allergy, they smile. Skip to breakfast, I can't eat a thing. Everything but they fruit is gluten filled. The one circle above is for they kindness of the servers going out of the way to make me an egg. Then one of them returns and scolds me for not informing the hotel I have an allergy!!!!! I inform her I made it very clear how ill gluten makes me and how I even reminded the front on my arrival I have a problem with gluten. We will never return and I will never recommend the hotel to anyone.
reviews.title: Never again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Harbour House Hotel is a small boutique inn that combines a beautiful facility, helpful staff and a great location just a bit off the beaten path. After numerous stays at other NOTL hotels we decided to try Harbour House as an alternative to the much larger places. It started off GREAT and could have been disasterous had it not been for the incredibly personable staff who sought to make an unpleasant situation RIGHT. We had a third floor room on an unseasonably warm winter day/night that led to massive amounts of snow melt. All night long the water dripped/POURED onto the tin surface surrounding the window outside our room and made sleeping tough. We shared our experience at check-out the next morning and the manager immediately came up with a resolution that we found very acceptable. We will return because of the superior customer service and attention to detail. The breakfast, by the way, is fabulous. So much more than a continental breakfast. Ifyou want COZY, quaint, convenient and a cordial staff....stay here.
reviews.title: COZY...best to describe....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: What sets this apart from the others in the area (and l have been to most of them) are the little extra touches and the friendly staff. They go above and beyond their job description. Spent a day shopping and then stayed the night with my Mother. Will definitely be back, but l'll bring my husband next time ;)
reviews.title: Home away from home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I have been attending the Shaw Festival for over twelve years--always staying a week in the same, very nice rented home. This year we decided to try staying for eight days in a suite at the Harbour House Hotel. We expected the change would involve giving up some of the things we enjoyed about staying in a home. Not at all. We had all the privacy we wanted coupled with all the services of a great hotel. The breakfasts were outstanding and had a wide enough selection that both of us could find plenty that fit our very idiosyncratic diets. Even the coffee was first class. The suite was spotless, the bed great. When I off-handedly mentioned to the front desk that the lighting was a little dim for reading, I was pleasantly surprised upon returning to the room that three new lamps had been added. All of that and a well-trained, kind and solicitous staff.
reviews.title: Wonderful in every way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is in a great location, close to the center of town and the Niagara river. The staff very friendly and informative. The rooms are wonderfull and the breakfast was delicious with lots of variety. We are planning to go back.
reviews.title: perfect weekend getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This small inn has all the right personal touches to make it a special home away from home. Each room has a lovely decor (including a fireplace), the service is superb, and the breakfast is delightful. We've been back three times, and it's always a perfectly relaxing stay.
reviews.title: Perfect Weekend Getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just went back to Harbour House to celebrate our 1st anniversary..the same hotel where we were married in last year. We absolutely adore this place! Everything about it is wonderful - the rooms, the location, the breakfast, the luxurious beds...but especially the staff! They go out of their way to make you feel special, and they are all very genuine, nice people. We can't wait to return - we would live here if we could! :o)
reviews.title: They treat us like Rock Stars!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: BTW - Don't miss dinner at the Charles Inn - you won't be disappointed!
reviews.title: Fourth time and still loving EVERY second!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were recommended this hotel by a close personal friend and what a recommendation....From the moment you arrive you are treated like a like royalty, starting with a personal tour around the hotel and your room by one of the excellent staff. A complimentary wine and cheese tasting is offered to guests late afternoon and is then followed by a complimentary shuttle bus to your restaurant of choice in town - so you can relax and enjoy yourselves. Finally you go back to your large king size room with all the amentities (including a fireplace) to bed down and watch a dvd from their extensive library collection. Oh, and did we forget that complimentary internet connection is also available?
reviews.title: Magnificent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Finish your stay with an outstanding fresh European breakfast and you have a five star experience. Why would you want to stay anywhere else when visiting Niagara on the Lake? This experience is a must. Thank you all at Harbour House.
reviews.title: Ambiance Plus!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Harbour House Hotel is definitely a cut above. A warm welcome from all the staff - they couldn't do enough for us. Lovely fireplace in the cozy lobby, with wine and cheese served in the late afternoon. The rooms are elegant yet comfortable - ours had a jetted tub and glass walk-in shower, and spectacular view of the boats moored at the marina.
reviews.title: Impressive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is not the steely, ultra modern type. It is reminscent of the Sooke Harbour House on Vancouver Island - casually elegant in a warm, comfortable, 'coastal" kind of way.. If you enjoy quality and genuine service, this is the place!
reviews.title: wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Our stay couldn't have been better. We've stayed at beautiful properties before, many of them 4 star...this property exceeded all of them. It should be a five-star hotel. From the moment we walked in the front door until we left, we were treated like royalty...escorted to our beautiful room that had the music softly playing already, cookies waiting for us as well as stationery with our name printed on it. We were offered (and received) transport to and from dinner even though it was only a few blocks away. The free breakfast was delicious with a wide variety of cold and warm selections. The server was personable and efficient, giving us great tips on places to visit. Beds were wonderfully comfortable, and the fireplace just added to the wonderful ambiance. Most importantly, the room and bathroom wer spotlessly clean, and the turn-down service was a nice touch (a piece of chocolate on the pillow would have made it even nicer) . We will definitely be going back! I've been to the Pillar and Post and Queen's Landing at previous visits, and this hotel far surpasses both of them in service, ambiance, and comfort.
reviews.title: So welcoming and comfortable!

description: With a design reminiscent of maritime life in the 1880's, Harbour House captures the essence of historic Niagara-on-the-Lake. Overlooking the Niagara River, Harbour House is within easy walking distance to the Shaw Festival theatres and many fine restaurants, shops and galleries. Our 31 guestrooms and suites feature king-size feather-top beds, whirlpool tubs, fireplaces and entertainment centres. Our tariffs include a European-style breakfast served in the conservatory.
